primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Son of God enters into total abandonment and Godforsakenness to bear the weight of human sin and deliver humanity from condemnation.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... proceeded to relinquish every form of power
he was preparing to shoulder a weight
he gives his own person to us
to deliver you and me from the condemnation
the overwhelming joy of our deliverance
the Father and the Son acting together, with one will, for one purpose

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied as 'the Lord moving in your heart') and the Evangelist Mark
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord is moving in your heart to draw you to himself
St. Mark wants you to know
the dread of the Godforsakenness of sin
a weight not only of death, but of God’s eternal condemnation
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the ontological weight of eternal condemnation and abandonment by God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of repentance and willingness to enter the Passion story.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's action is a response to the completed work of the primary subject (Jesus).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Unified Will of God → Deliverance → Humanity

voorbeelden_god_subject: God made Jesus to be sin
Jesus... proceeded to relinquish every form of power
the Son of God bore away from us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we ask God to look upon us

voorbeelden: We must work hard at recovering its original impact
willingness means that the Lord is moving in your heart
Mark wanted his readers to understand the meaning
Jesus... makes it happen, in his own person

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to do what man cannot do (bear sin), transforming the hearer's 'willingness' (Vouloir) through grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the illusion of S1 (Palm Sunday joy) to the reality of S2 (The Cross), then revealing that Christ's S2 is the source of our true S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary Atonement: Christ takes S2 so the Receiver gets S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; abandonment is described as the 'greatest fear of all'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actant who achieves what the hearer cannot. Human action is framed as a response to a prior divine movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We must work hard at recovering its original impact.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... makes it happen, in his own person.
a weight that for all he knew might truly crush him forever.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is specifically contrasted with human examples like Socrates to show his role is unique, not exemplary.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is the Substitute, not the Example.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from fear to joy.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (Christ's work) to the secondary (our response) is seamless and logically grounded in the text.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the representative man, our substitute... deliver you and me from the condemnation that the Son of God bore away from us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (the Lord) creates the 'willingness' in the hearer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin leads to total Godforsakenness.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by Christ's agency. The hearer is positioned as the beneficiary of a cosmic exchange.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current focus on Christ's Pouvoir.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a grace-oriented sermon that maintains God as the Subject of the active verbs of salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'strange day' hook, semiotics reveals the underlying substitutionary engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark's Aramaic; semiotics explains why Mark's choice of actants (the silent, suffering Son) is necessary for the hearer's deliverance.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'willingness' of the hearer is actually a 'Helper' actant provided by the 'Sender', preventing the sermon from becoming a work of the will.

volledige_subject_lijst: God made Jesus to be sin
The Son of God bore away
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by explicitly rejecting the Socrates comparison.
